bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
When I run streamlit hello it works very well in my local browser. When I try to connect from another computer on the network, using the provided network url or using the local ip address of the computer running the app, streamlit seems to get stuck on connecting. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Run streamlit hello with another computer on the same network go to other.ip.address:port
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I expected to be able to access the running app over the network, and being able to see the hello-example in the browser on another computer. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
On the computer not running the app, you do see that it is trying to do something but it never connects to the streamlit server. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30178487/66990078-d25c5200-f0c5-11e9-9302-2f1772f2bee8.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no, I have not had this work before <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.47.0, 0.48.1 Python version: 3.6.8 Python3 with venv OS version: ubuntu Browser version: chrome, firefox
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
If needed, add any other context about the problem here.
